alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued September 09 at 3:04AM PDT until September 09 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM THIS EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TODAY TO MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with temperatures 90 to 95. For the High Wind Warning, east winds 20 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas. * IMPACTS...Downed trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses.
info.instruction: Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
